column4: I have a problem sharing my folder (ubuntu 8.04 on a dual boot win xp Dell Laptop) with my windows 7 PC on my home network
i have installed samba package, made sure my workgroup name is same as windows, but when i go to win 7 i cannot see my linux machine
try to check if nmbd is running
u need to alow the ports in ufw too, if ufw is running
sorry noob here i dont know what to type for nmdb or what is ufw
nmbd is the daemon responsible of resolving names in windows networks
but if you dont have access by IP could be something else
can u ping the linux from windows ?
what is the ip of the linux ?
not good that is not the good adapter
make sure u have a supported network adapter
ip addr ls and see the ip
try to ping that from wondows
maybe winscp in windows and a ssh server on ubuntu
it doesnt matter it is just a name :D and your welcome
